body: Which mutation is associated with PLMS (periodic limb movements in sleep)?
ideal_answer: missense substitution, Met1Val (M1V), was identified in the DCX gene
exact_answer: missense substitution, Met1Val (M1V), in the DCX gene.

snippets.text: We describe a 2-year-old girl affected by SBH with epilepsy and periodic limb movements (PLMs), in whom a novel "de novo" missense substitution, Met1Val (M1V), was identified in the DCX gene.
